content.content: 1. In this Regulation, “adult” means a person eighteen years of age or over; (“adulte”) “child” means a person over the age of five years and under the age of thirteen years; (“enfant”) “family” means either a father or mother or both plus one or more of their sons or daughters under eighteen years of age; (“famille”) “senior citizen” means a person sixty-five years of age or over; (personne âgée”) “student” means, (a) a person who is at least thirteen years of age but who has not yet attained the age of eighteen, or (b) a person eighteen years of age or over who is in full-time attendance at an educational institution in Canada and is in possession of a student registration card for the current academic year. (“étudiant”) R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 866, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
1. In this Regulation,

“adult” means a person eighteen years of age or over; (“adulte”)

“child” means a person over the age of five years and under the age of thirteen years; (“enfant”)

“family” means either a father or mother or both plus one or more of their sons or daughters under eighteen years of age; (“famille”)

“senior citizen” means a person sixty-five years of age or over; (personne âgée”)

“student” means,

(a) a person who is at least thirteen years of age but who has not yet attained the age of eighteen, or

(b) a person eighteen years of age or over who is in full-time attendance at an educational institution in Canada and is in possession of a student registration card for the current academic year. (“étudiant”) R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 866, s. 1.

content.content: 2. The fee for entrance to the Museum is, (a) for each adult, $2.50; (b) for each child, $1.00; (c) for each senior citizen who is in possession of proof of age, $1.25; (d) for each student, $1.50; (e) for each family, $6.00; and (f) for members of group tours, (i) for each adult, $2.00, (ii) for each secondary school student, $1.50, and (iii) for each elementary school student, $1.00. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 866, s. 2. Français
content.raw_html:
2. The fee for entrance to the Museum is,

(a) for each adult, $2.50;

(b) for each child, $1.00;

(c) for each senior citizen who is in possession of proof of age, $1.25;

(d) for each student, $1.50;

(e) for each family, $6.00; and

(f) for members of group tours,

(i) for each adult, $2.00,

(ii) for each secondary school student, $1.50, and

(iii) for each elementary school student, $1.00. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 866, s. 2.

Français
